search_results.snippet: The difference is that a demonstrative adjective is found before the noun in a sentence, and a demonstrative pronoun takes the place of the noun in a sentence. search_results.snippet: Demonstrative adjectives indicate exactly which noun the speaker means and where it is (or they are) relative to the position of the speaker. If the noun in question is nearby, he uses this (singular) or these (plural). If the noun is out of the speaker's reach, he uses that (singular) or those (plural).
